CatDescriptText: Mr. Wayman Stevens, 3272 Arlington Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 1, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that high school students should strike in order to air grievances or to gain their objectives?"  Answer reads: "No, I don't think that it's right, because the students are going over their head. It shows that the children are ignoring the authority of the teachers.  The teachers should be respected."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Wayman Stevens wearing striped shirt and leather jacket with knit sleeves, holding newspaper standing in front of corner of stone building that reads "Johnston & Murphy McGreg[or]"
